CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1962, pg. 5, reads: "Tots Escape Blaze - Snatched from danger by kindly and alert neighbors, three tots of Mr. and Mrs. Wade Bailey, 905 Mohler St., escaped injury here Monday, at 10:45 A. M., when flames gutted the structure. Fire officials reported that the youngsters were alone in house when neighbors noted billowing clouds of smoke.  Engine Co. 29, first to reach the scene, lingered 3 hours and 47 minutes at the site before declaring all danger eliminated."
TitMainTitle: Crowd watching fire fighters working fire in two story house of Bailey family, 905 Mohler Street, Homewood
